results.title: Nuggit & Goofs
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short recounts the story of ‘Nuggit’, an alien and his friend ‘Goofs’ the horse as they go on an exciting adventure into the deep dark forest. They are scared out of their wits as they are surrendered and attacked by enormous black killer spiders. They flee from the forest, never to return.

results.title: Longing for belonging
results.creator_credit: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Harrison’s search for belonging is a road trip with a lot of potholes along the way. Of mixed descent, she has longed to connect with her Indigenous heritage, which has forced her to confront some issues and attitudes within Australian society today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Nine lives
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Using multiple locations such as Bourke Street, school playgrounds and the beach, a group of students show us their acrobatic abilities, jumping off sides of wallls, sculptures and common school playground equipment.

results.title: Monica Street
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short story features a girls’ journey walking along a street called ‘Monica Street’. She encounters an art gallery; music shop and a costume shop. The end of her journey sees her being invited to a Jewish meal at her friend’s house.

results.title: Experience the unknown
results.creator_credit: Valentina Zingg, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Overwhelmed by choice, Valentina Zingg decides to journey to a land very different to Switzerland. While this hot, dry land helps her gain perspective, there is still something missing…
results.creator_credit_for_label: Valentina Zingg, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Imagery of the mind
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An animated short about a character using his imagination to fight the boredom of his mundane life.

results.title: Expand my boundaries
results.creator_credit: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When she was given the opportunity to study in Melbourne, Denise VanWyk and her family seized it with both hands. She marvels at her new home, its diversity, acceptance and relaxed atmosphere.

results.title: Gangs
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated work relates the story of a young naive boy’s horrific beating by a vicious student from his school. The young boy calls his older brother - a member of a gang, to avenge his beating. The older brother gathers up his friends and visits the student at his school and beats him in the school toilets. The vicious student retaliates by murdering the young boy. A bleak story of revenge.

results.title: Bus people
results.creator_credit: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When you’re poor, there’s nothing as important as finding food. Nicole Bloom movingly recalls her distressing time on the streets, amongst the poor people of Melbourne, when riding on the bus is a luxury.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
